item.title: EA Employees Publicly Oppose Sale To Saudi Arabia And Equity Firms
item.content:encoded:
Employees at Electronic Arts (EA) and members of the Communication Workers of America (CWA) have released a statement regarding the pending acquisition and privatization of the company. In the joint statement, union members working at EA state that they weren’t properly represented during sale negotiations and that there is a worry of company layoffs when it happens.

The group says this $55 billion deal will “further concentrate power and wealth into the hands of a few gatekeepers while doing nothing to address the concerns of players and workers.”

“EA is not a struggling company,” the statement says. “With annual revenues reaching $7.5 billion and $1 billion in profit each year, EA is one of the largest video game developers and publishers in the world. EA’s success has been entirely driven by tens of thousands of EA workers whose creativity, skill, and innovation made EA worth buying in the first place.” 

“Yet we, the very people who will be jeopardized as a result of this deal, were not represented at all when this buyout was negotiated or discussed.” 

The group says that if any layoffs take place or if studios close, it’s because of a choice to do so and not something done out of necessity. They say that it would be a move done solely to “pad investors’ pockets—not to strengthen the company.”

In addition to the statement, the union has launched a petition for the United States Federal Trade Commission to look more into this deal. They are “calling on regulators and elected officials to scrutinize this deal and ensure that any path forward protects jobs, and preserves creative freedom.”

The announcement of a deal to sell EA to a group that includes the Saudi Arabia Public Investment Fund, Silver Lake, and Jared Kushner’s Affinity Partners came in late September. To fund the sale, EA will be taking on $20 billion in debt, which many worry will lead to the aforementioned layoffs.

“Every time private equity or billionaire investors take a studio private, workers lose visibility, transparency, and power,” they say. “Decisions that shape our jobs, our art, and our futures are made behind closed doors by executives who have never written a line of code, built worlds, or supported live services.”

The statement closes by saying that the “value of video games is in their workers” and that they are “standing together and refusing to let corporate greed decide the future of our industry.”

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1581: Hints And Answer For October 17, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1581 for October 17, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you just want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a trending topic online.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There currently isn’t an app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, October 17, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1581 gives most players a challenge, but not as much as the last few days. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.2 guesses out of 6 to get. That makes it easier than October 16’s 4.6-guess average.

General Wordle Hints For October 17

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The word contains a repeated letter.
  • Hint 2: It starts with G.
  • Hint 3: In everyday speech, it often means disgusting or nasty.
  • Hint 4: It’s also an accounting/finance term for a total before deductions.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1581 for October 17, 2025

Starter Words For October 17, 2025

If you just want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • GHOST
  • SASSY
  • GLOSS

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1581 On October 17, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: GROSS

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1580 on October 16, 2025:

Answer: CATTY

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1581?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on October 18 will be Wordle Game #1582.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game tasks players with guessing a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: Former Dead or Alive & Ninja Gaiden Director Tomonobu Itagaki Has Passed Away
item.content:encoded:
Team Ninja has just announced that their first leader, Tomonobu Itagaki, has unfortunately passed away.

All eyes are on Team Ninja right now, as their highly anticipated installment to the Ninja Gaiden franchise arrives on October 21, 2025. We have already seen a lot of the game through several trailers and teasers, and it seems that it’s going to be a difficult one. However, less than a week before release, one of the most integral people behind the franchise’s revival has passed away.

Team Ninja’s First Leader Passed Away a Few Days Before Ninja Gaiden 4’s Release

Tomonobu Itagaki’s passing was announced through Team Ninja’s X account (formerly Twitter). The post stated:

We are deeply saddened by the passing of Team NINJA’s first leader, Tomonobu Itagaki.

We will carry on the philosophy and creativity that Itagaki-san began and continue to create games that many gamers will enjoy.

Our deepest condolences for his loss.

From everyone at Team NINJA

For those unaware, Tomonobu Itagaki is a renowned Japanese video game designer who started his journey at Tecmo in 1992. Itagaki’s claim to success came with 1996’s Dead or Alive. In 2001, Itagaki was named Team Ninja’s first leader, where he revived the 1988 arcade franchise Ninja Gaiden and released it for Xbox in 2004. The title received widespread critical acclaim and an international online tournament.

Following that, the Team Ninja leader helped release Ninja Gaiden Black, Ninja Gaiden: Dragon Sword, and Ninja Gaiden II. He then left Tecmo in 2008 due to a fallout and founded Vallhalla Game Studios, where he helped develop Devil’s Third with some former Team Ninja members. Then, in 2021, Itagaki created another studio, called Itagaki Games.

item.title: Best Meta Battlefield 6 Assault Rifle Loadout—All Attachments, How To Unlock & Equipment
item.content:encoded:
While Battlefield 6 has a fun and varied arsenal, nothing beats the best assault rifle, and our top meta loadout ensures the weapon has you locked in and will get you more kills than if you used any other AR.

An assault rifle is a staple of online FPS shooters. Sniper Rifles aren’t always applicable, Shotguns also depend on the size of the map, LMGs are powerful but as mobile as a tank, and SMGs also fall into that ‘circumstantial’ territory. An assault rifle is an all-around beast, and even the bad ones are good.

Battlefield 6 has a reliable foundation of assault rifles to kickstart the game, so let’s see which AR is considered to be the meta selection, and we’ll take a deep dive into its best loadout and more.

What Is The Best Assault Rifle In Battlefield 6?

The consensus is that the M433 is the best meta assault rifle in Battlefield 6, which is no surprise as it’s an extremely effective weapon at most ranges.

Whether you used it in Battlefield 6‘s campaign or online, the M433 is a monstrous weapon. Everything about it works: Firepower, fire rate, recoil control, its default ammo clip size, mobility, and handling. It’s literally the perfect assault rifle, and it only gets better once you start applying the best attachments to it.

Our best M433 assault rifle class focuses on reducing recoil and making it more efficient and effective during combat. It’s not the most attachments you can have for the gun—so feel free to tinker and add more—but this is a simple and relatively easy to put together loadout.

Here’s our best M433 assault rifle meta loadout.

How To Unlock M433 Assault Rifle In Battlefield 6

You’ll be pleased to know that the M433 assault rifle is unlocked by default at the beginning of your Battlefield 6 online multiplayer journey!

It wouldn’t be convenient if all weapons were locked when you start playing Battlefield 6 online, would it? Some guns need to be available, and the M433 is one of them. This means you can equip it right away and start leveling it up fast and earning XP.

Best Assault Rifle Class Setup In Battlefield 6

Alongside your M433 assault rifle, you also need the right equipment and abilities. From Frontliner to the M87A1 Shotgun, we’ve picked out the gear you need to complement the M433 perfectly.

Check out each slot and what to put in it:

  • Field Specs: Frontliner
  • Sidearm: P18 (Pistol)
  • Gadget 1: M87A1 (Shotgun)
  • Gadget 2: Deploy Beacon
  • Throwable: Fragmentation Grenade
  • Melee: Sledgehammer

Frontliner is preferable from Field Specs (once you unlock it) as it speeds up health recovery, reduces fall damage, and gives a brief buff to spawning teammates. It’s just a generally great set of abilities that aim to keep you alive for longer and make you stronger.

The P18 is the best and most consistent Pistol in Battlefield 6, so that’s an easy one. We’ve opted for the M87A1 shotgun as the first gadget, as that’s the best shotgun in the game. It’s unstoppable, and the perfect option for close-range combat. Whereas the Deploy Beacon gets you—and your squad—back into the fray faster.

The Fragmentation Grenade is a standard Frag Grenade that’s great for puncturing holes in the walls and enemies, and speaking of both of those things, the Sledgehammer is a beastly, bludgeoning no-brainer.

item.title: ‘Human-Like’ AI Characters with Memories and Personalities Created by EGO AI
item.content:encoded:
Today, a San Francisco-based AI company has announced the launch of character.world, an AI engine that allows for the creation of ‘human-like’ characters with memories, personalities, and the ability to form relationships with users.

This technology is built on the Character Context Protocol (CCP), an open-source product from EGO AI, which allows for the seamless integration of powerful and authentic AI-powered NPCs across various games, apps, and platforms, including Discord and Twitch.

The announcement went hand-in-hand with the unveiling of almost $7 million in seed funding to further bolster these AI-driven creations entering the market.

‘Living, Persistent Characters Who Can Make Games Richer’

In a press release, the CEO of EGO, Vishnu Hari, explained:

Games and digital worlds have always struggled with flat, scripted non-player characters (NPCs) that feel mechanical and forgettable. EGO AI is tackling that head-on with characters who act, react and remember like real players.

Our mission is to move beyond chat windows and give people living, persistent characters who can make games richer, worlds more alive and interactions more meaningful.

In a short video presenting the abilities of EGO AI, the company showcased how a user can talk directly to an AI NPC powered by the CCP technology, getting an instant response that’s contextualized and makes sense. The AI NPC remembered the conversation and referred to it later, even recalling a topic when talking to the user outside the initial game.

Here’s the video:

These are very early days for EGO AI, but investors are excited about the potential. In a statement, Adam Draper of Boost VC, one of the investors in EGO AI, said:

What excites me about Ego is their approach to one of gaming’s biggest challenges: creating characters that truly feel alive.

Their foundation model is a breakthrough in AI character behavior. We’re entering a new era where AI characters will carry personality, memory, and emotion—indistinguishable from human players—and Ego is positioned to lead it. And Vish is the most resilient founder in the space.

In an extensive whitepaper, EGO AI explained everything that goes into the technology driving these AI characters and laid out the benefits, including:

  • More authentic gameplay
  • Automatic population of game worlds
  • Automated play and balance testing

Each AI character will have a personality, needs, emotions, and memory features that enable them to feel as human as possible, and EGO AI has promised that this is the ground floor for this technology.

It obviously has some concerning elements circulating around it, the most critical of which is the inherent threat to human actors who would otherwise play these roles. This will likely fire up a debate when EGO AI becomes more public.

Are you eager to see more technology like this surface, or would you rather stick to traditional methods of portraying NPCs? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.
